Synopsys Strikes $35 Billion Deal to Buy Ansys

By Don Clark

Technology Briefing | Software: Synopsys Settles Cadence Lawsuit

Synopsis, maker of software for integrated circuit design, will pay $265 million to Cadence Design Systems to settle civil source code trade-secrets lawsuit against Avanti Corp, which was acquired by Synopsis in 2001 (S)

By Bloomberg News

Technology Briefing | Software: Cadence Profit Surges On Flat Sales

Cadence Design Systems says pro forma net profit surged 44 percent in first quarter from year earlier, while revenue was flat; reports net earnings of $21.3 million, up from $3.8 million year ago; excluding extraordinary items, company reports pro forma earnings of $60 million compared with $41.7 million; revenue was $345 million; graph (S)

By Laurie J. Flynn (NYT COMPILED BY ALAN KRAUSS)

Technology Briefing | Software: Mentor Graphics Wins a Round

Court rules that Cadence Design Systems' MercuryPlus product, made by company's Quickturn unit, infringes on patent held by Mentor Graphics; trial on remaining issues of case is scheduled for October; graph (S)

By Laurie J. Flynn (NYT COMPILED BY ALAN KRAUSS)

Investing; Software Niche Offers A Rare Tech Bright Spot

Stocks of electronic design automation companies, which make software tools that allow semiconductor companies to design chips as well as to make verification software that ensures that chips work properly, have held up relatively well during tecnology sector's collapse; leading companies in this sector are Cadence Design Systems, Mentor Graphics and Synopsis (M)

By Caroline Waxler

COMPANY NEWS

COMPANY NEWS; AVANT SHARES SLIDE AFTER RULING BY CALIFORNIA JUDGE

Shares of Avant Corp, maker of computer software, fall as much as 39 percent after California state judge orders company to pay $182 million plus interest to Cadence Design Systems Inc for taking Cadence computer code to include in its products (S)

By Bloomberg News
